intro: Bellynkxia triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters and features trifoliate leaves, giving it its common name. Bellynkxia triphylla thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and woodland settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long blooming period from late spring to early summer.
